direction.raw_text: In the middle of all the pain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did the baby come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby they made up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From their heads...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that where they say it came from... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they say it came from the waste paper basket!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd it come from before that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After God... before the waste-paper basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes, how are babies born?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I do,    but I want you to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very agitated) I don't understand what you're talking about... you want to talk about the baby... everybody wants to talk about    the baby but... I never saw the    baby so I can't talk about the baby    because... I don't believe in the    baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elderly nun looks out the window into the courtyard where Martha and Agnes are walking, then pulls the curtain across. 22   EXT - COURTYARD - DAY Martha and Agnes are walking together. Martha is smoking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at the moment, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any children?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't have them any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've stopped menstruating
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you smoke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it bother you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoking is an    obsession with me. Maybe one day    I'll become obsessed with something    else, then I'll stop smoking... Do    you have any more questions?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? They both halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you think babies come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes sits down on a bench and Martha follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha stands up, disturbed. Agnes is slightly delirious with happiness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And her cry echoes all around and the doves fly out of the bell tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam is standing checking some papers when Martha enters. Mother Miriam seems to have entirely regained her good humour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam removes the tray from under a pot plant and bangs it down in front of Martha to act as an ashtray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha's car exits out of the convent and heads up the road. 25   INT - CAR - DAY The car radio is playing light band music...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha flicks the radio off and stops the car. She thinks for a moment then... 26   EXT - LONELY ROAD - DAY ... she turns the car around and heads back in the direction she came. 27   EXT - PRESBYTERY - DAY Martha drives in through an entrance and pulls up outside the presbytery. 28   INT - PRESBYTERY - DAY From inside the house, Martha can be seen knocking on the glass fronted door.     Presently a huge, fat HOUSEKEEPER answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The housekeeper indicates she should enter and walks back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move into the next room. The housekeeper goes further calling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha stands uncertainly at the doorway. The sound of thumping is heard, and then the figure of a very old priest, FATHER MARTINEAU appears walking with a stick. 29   INT - PRESBYTERY DINING ROOM - DAY Father Martineau and Martha are having tea. He pours a slug of whisky from a   flask into her cup and an even larger slug into his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An elderly WOMAN is sitting watching "Spiderman" on TV cackling with laughter. She is physically alright, but quite senile. Martha enters, goes over to her and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is raining... distant thunder in the background. Martha is standing under an umbrella talking to Sister Anne who is feeding the chickens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sister Anne points up to a window on the corner of the convent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam unlocks a padlock on the door, opens it for Martha. They both      enter the room which is totally plain, stripped of everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flashback:   Agnes, all in white is lying face down in the sign of the cross in front of the altar. Mother Miriam enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam stops in front of Agnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam glances up at an older NUN who has been in the chapel watching all along. She takes the hint and hobbles out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then let's talk about something else...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (standing) No... no, I'm tired of talking, I've been talking for weeks, nobody believes me when I tell them anything... nobody listens to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (also standing) Agnes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (opens the door) No... no, I don't want to answer any more questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to ask them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pausing in the doorway) What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just that... you ask and I'll answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Anything. 21   INT - NUN'S ROOM - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's your real name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Martha Louise Livingston.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a pause)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From their mothers and fathers of course. Before that, I... I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I think they come from... angel lights on their mothers chest and whispers into her ear. That makes good babies start to grow. And bad babies come from when a fallen angel squeezes in down there, and they start to grow, grow, till they come out down there. I don't know where good babies come out. And you can't tell the difference... except bad babies cry a lot... and they make their fathers go away... and their mothers get very ill... die sometimes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) Mummy wasn't very happy when she died ... and, I think she went to hell because every time I see her she looks like she just stepped out of a hot shower, and I... I'm never sure if it's her, or the Lady who tells me things! They fight over me all the time. (staring into space) The Lady... I saw when I was ten. I was lying on the grass, looking at the sun, and the sun became a cloud, and the cloud became, a Lady. And she told me she would talk to me. And then... her feet began to bleed and I saw there... there were holes in her hands and in her side. And I tried to catch the blood as it fell from the sky, but I couldn't see any more because my eyes hurt because there were big black spots in front of them. And she tells me things like, like... right now she's crying Marie! Marie! ... but I don't know what that means.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) ... and... she uses me to sing, it's as if she's throwing a big hook through the air and it catches me under my ribs and tries to pull me up, and I... I can't move because Mommy's holding my feet and all I can do is sing in her voice... it's the Lady's voice, God loves you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) (to Martha) God loves you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know a Marie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why should I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. 23   INT - MOTHER MIRIAM'S STUDY - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... what do you think? Is she totally bananas or merely slightly off centre... or maybe she's perfectly sane and just a very good liar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's your opinion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe Agnes is different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From other nuns... (laughs) Yes I... I've noticed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From other people! (moving across the room) I believe she is not crazy, nor is she lying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How could she have a baby and know nothing of sex or birth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because she's an innocent. She's a slate that's hasn't been touched except by God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lights a cigarette) That's ridiculous...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moves to her desk, starts writing) In her case it isn't. She's had very little schooling. Her mother kept her home almost all the time and when her mother died Agnes came here, to us. She's never been out there Doctor. She's never seen a movie or a television show. She's never even read a book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If she's so innocent, how come she murdered a child?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She didn't! This is manslaughter, not murder. She didn't consciously kill that baby. She'd lost a lot of blood. She was unconscious by the time we got to her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, someone else could have done it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... not in the eyes of the police.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And in your eyes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've already told you what I thought.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That she was unconscious, yes! So someone easily could have come in the room and killed the...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't really believe something like that happened do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's possible isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of the other nuns found out about the baby and... and wanted to avoid a scandal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's absurd!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That possibility never occurred to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No-one knew about Agnes' pregnancy. No-one. Not even Agnes. 24   EXT - CONVENT - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You have been listening to Mostly Music from Montreal. This is CBC Radio. (and again in French)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is Father Martineau in please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in French) ???
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (answers in French) ???
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (halting briefly) Wipe your feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pere Martineau... (in French) ???
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (French accent) They arise at five in the morning... and they're in bed by nine at night. Even if a man could get to them, he would probably find them praying. That's why I see that the real question is not only how he got in, but when.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you're the only man to see them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise you Doctor, even if I had the inclination, how could I possibly catch her? She would have to be a very slow and patient nun. (they both laugh) Ah no... they're a very special and rare people those Sisters. Only a few of them left in this modern world, consecrated to the praise of God. 30   INT - NURSING HOME, LOUNGE - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Mama (pulls up a chair) ... brought you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up, I'm trying to watch this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's your favourite...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's Martha, Mama. (hands over a tub of icecream) There you go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marie brings me icecream too you know. Chocolate... my favourite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought cherry-vanilla was your favourite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not any more... now I like chocolate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stroking her hair) Did you have a good week Mama. Are they treating you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know Martha never comes to see me. You watch it, she's going straight to hell... after all the things she said to me. Then she marries that son of a bitch of a Frenchman... has an abortion. I knew that one wouldn't work out. Not like you Marie. You got married to God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lighting up) Marie's dead Mama.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remember when you    was a little girl Marie. You come back    from the movies and you'd say - Mama    that ending was so sad... and I'd tell    you they had all the happy endings locked    away in a vault in Hollywood. (chuckles) And you believed me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mama, that wasn't Marie, that was me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a long pause) Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... I'm Martha, Mama. 31   EXT - CONVENT, CHICKENYARD - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The convent was built for over fifty. Not many of us left... just us and the chickens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you survive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, we own the land around here. But we rent it out. We keep a few acres for ourselves, (indicating) some wheat, corn, some vegetables.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well that's a lot of land. You must have help. Do you have field hands that help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. We work the land alone. No-one but Sister Marguerite and I are permitted contact with the public.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sister Anne, which was Agnes' room?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh that one there, in the corner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The one up on the third floor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh huh. 32   INT - AGNES' OLD ROOM - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This convent is locked solid. The only one that has a key is Sister Marguerite and she wouldn't let Christ in after dark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's been known to happen in the day too. Maybe Agnes went to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh come on, you've talked to her. She doesn't even know how babies are born, let alone made.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When did you first learn about her... innocence, the way she thinks?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shortly after she came to us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you weren't shocked?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was appalled, just as you are now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She stopped eating completely... 33   INT - CHAPEL - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) This was before her pregnancy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) About two years before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes, it has come to my attention that you have stopped eating. Why is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not looking up) I've been commanded by God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) He talked to you Himself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Through someone else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'd punish me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of the other Sisters?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) Why would she tell you to do this? ... Agnes look at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (looking up) Because I'm getting fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, for Heaven's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am, there's too much flesh on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a blimp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does it matter whether you're fat or not...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... You needn't worry about being attractive here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do, I have to be attractive to God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loves you the way you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No he doesn't. He hates fat people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who told you this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a sin to be fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at the statues, they're thin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because they're suffering... suffering is beautiful, I want to be beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who tells you these things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ said it in the Bible, he said - suffer the little children, I want to suffer like a little child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not what he meant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...    I am a little child but my body keeps    getting bigger and soon I... I won't    be able to fit in, I... I won't be able    to squeeze into Heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes dear, Heaven is not a place where... Agnes gets to her knees and pushes up her breasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I mean... I mean look at these. I've got to lose weight, I'm a blimp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my dear child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God blew up the Hindenburg. He'll blow me up, that's what she said...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mommy I'll get bigger and bigger every day and then I'll pop but... but if I stay little it won't happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother tells you this?... Agnes your mother is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she watches... she listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense, I'm your mother now and I want you to eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Mother Miriam looks down and is shocked to see Agnes' white habit is spotted with blood, and more blood is dripping onto the floor. She pulls out   Agnes' hand from her habit and gasps with shock; there is a bleeding hole in the middle of her palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She quickly leads Agnes out of the chapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in the present, as before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha walks out. Mother Miriam yanks the padlock out of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INT - CHAPEL - DAY All the Sisters are present. Mother Miriam leads the chant in Latin and the   rest of the nuns respond at intervals. Agnes is very happy. Their singing continues over, until the end of scene 41.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (genuinely distressed)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (standing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to eat something Agnes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No I don't... the host is enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dear, I don't think a communion wafer has the recommended daily allowance of anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Yes, of God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm being punished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dear Jesus...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It started this morning and I can't get it to stop. 34   INT - AGNES' OLD ROOM - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you take her to a doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was healed by the following morning and she started eating again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She had a... a hole in the palm of her hand! She could have bled to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But she didn't... did she. If anyone had seen what I'd seen she'd be public property... newspapermen, psychiatrists, ridicule. She doesn't deserve that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She has it now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know what you're thinking, she's a hysteric pure and simple.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not simple, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw it. Clean through the palm of her hand. Do you think hysteria could do that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's being doing it for centuries. She's not unique, she's just another victim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God's victim. That's her innocence. She belongs to God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I intend to take her away from Him. That's what you're afraid of isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You bet I am. 35
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 36      EXT - POLICE PRECINCT - DAY Martha and Larry are at the top of steps. He hands her an envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DISSOLVE TO: 37   EXT - CONVENT - DAY Agnes is happily swinging on a long swing attached to a tree. DISSOLVE TO: 38   INT - CRYPT - DAY The Sisters go about their tasks. Then all together they move to a corner of the room which is laid out with burning candles and make their devotions. DISSOLVE TO: 39   INT - CONFESSIONAL - DAY Agnes is confessing to a rather disinterested Father Martineau.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DISSOLVE TO: 40   INT - MARTHA'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Martha is leafing through a sheaf of police photographs of the sheets and the waste-paper basket. She puts the photos aside and puffs thoughtfully on a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here you are. Don't let anyone know where you got them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (kissing him) Thanks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Last Tuesday, I didn't eat all of my lima beans... hid them under my spoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very quietly) I thought... thoughts... about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Speak up, I can hardly hear you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very loudly) I thought ugly thoughts about Sister Marguerite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : 41   EXT - CONVENT FARM - DAY Agnes is milking the cow. She pours the milk into a large churn. (The singing finishes at this point). 42   INT - JUDGE'S OFFICE - DAY The same four are in a meeting. This time they are all sitting except for Lyon who is standing by the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a strange place; all the crosses are identical and very simple. Martha is standing. Agnes is kneeling in front of a cross marked with the name "Soeur Marie Paul" and the dates she was born, consecrated and died. Agnes places some winter flowers on the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes makes the sign of the cross, they both stand and start to move off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Agnes takes her. 44   INT - BELL TOWER - DAY Martha and Agnes enter the bell-tower. Agnes leads the way up the steep wooden steps. Martha becomes breathless almost immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes climbs up through the trapdoor to the bell platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha arrives exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes lies down under the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts to sing in a beautiful voice and the sound rings in the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes sings a little more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knew what was going to happen to me. That's why she hid me away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did she know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody told her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise I won't laugh. Who told her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An angel, when she was having one of her headaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did your mother see angels often?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe she really saw them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I can never tell her that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? (no answer) Mmm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'd get angry. Martha moves round close to Agnes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Would you tell me why the hell this is taking so long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look there are a lot of unanswered questions here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Martha, your job is to diagnose, not to heal and play detective. Who do you think you are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know my job. Don't tell me my job Lyon. My duty as a doctor is to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Martha, you have to make a decision on her sanity as quickly as possible and not interfere with due process of law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no, excuse me Eve. As quickly as I see fit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The longer you take to make a decision, the more difficult it will be for us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The bishop is breathing down our necks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the sooner she goes to prison, the better off she'll be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in French) ???
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't believe this. I don't bloody believe this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well the bishop will be very upset about this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fighting for this woman's life, not some bloody bishop. 43   EXT - CONVENT GRAVEYARD - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You liked Sister Paul?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was kind to me. She told me I was beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (crouching down) What else did she tell you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She said all of God's angels would want to sleep beside me if they could. I liked that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) She lived here for almost seventy years. Every day she'd ring the bell, wake us up, call us to God. She took me to my secret place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's that?... I promise I won't tell, would you take me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sister Paul was in her eighties?   Did she climb up here often?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, only when she felt like it. She brought me up here last winter and the next day she died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (halting, out of breath) No wonder... wait... Agnes... Agnes how do you feel about babies?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, they frighten me, I'm afraid I'll drop them. They have a soft spot on their heads and if you drop them so they land on their heads they become stupid. I was dropped on my head, that's why I don't understand things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (climbing again) Numbers... you can spend your whole life counting and never reach the end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (following her) I don't understand them either. Do you suppose I was dropped on my head?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope not. It's a terrible thing to be dropped on your head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I've got to give up smoking. Agnes ... wait a minute... Agnes slow down. 45   EXT - TOP OF BELLTOWER - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She said you could see the whole world from up here. But it looks much better far away than it looks close up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beautiful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And sometimes I get under here... it makes a wonderful sound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happens if the bell rings and you're under there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, it's even more wonderful then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's like hiding from my mother when I was a little girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no place as wonderful as this. Agnes... have you ever thought of leaving the convent for something else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. There is nothing else. Just being here at night helps me sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have trouble sleeping?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I get headaches. Mommy did too... oh, but she wasn't stupid. She knew things that nobody else knew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sitting up)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Agnes, did you love your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever want to be a mother yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could never be a mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I don't think I'm old enough and besides I don't want to have a baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I don't want one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you did want one, how'd you go about getting one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From someone who didn't want to have a baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly frustrated) No, not like me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would that person get one if they didn't want one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (jumping to her feet) A mistake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes, how did your mother get you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mistake... it was a mistake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what she said?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha puts her arm out to Agnes who slaps it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes disappears down through the trapdoor. Martha throws her cigarette away. 46   INT - CONVENT - DAY Mother Miriam is comforting a tearful Agnes. She sees Martha coming across   the courtyard and pushes Agnes gently away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam starts to walk away, Martha angrily follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha and Mother Miriam are climbing the stairs. They pause briefly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and aren't any worse off than you Mother. People who've gone through their entire lives without bending their knees once, to anybody. And people who fall in love and have babies and occas- sionally are very happy. She has a right to know that. But you and your... your order and your Church have kept her ignorant... They reach Mother Miriam's study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ???     (distorted)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ??? (distorted) ... virginity, right Mother? Poverty, chastity and ignorance is what you live by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not a virgin, Doctor. I was married for twenty three years, two daughters. I even have grandchildren... surprised? It might please you to know that I was a failure as a wife and mother. My children won't even see me any more, that's their revenge. I think they tell their friends that I've passed on. And don't tell me I'm making up for past mistakes Doctor Freud. (she sits)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then help her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're shielding her. Let her face the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What good would it do. No matter what you decide it's either the... the prison or the nut house and the differences between them are pretty thin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's another choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aquittal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long pause. The tension between them dissolves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha holds her hand. 47   INT - MOTHER MIRIAM'S STUDY - DAY Same place, but a little later. Martha is smoking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam moves to her desk and opens the day book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flashback: the sisters are sitting around the table at dinner. SISTER GENEVIEVE, the other novice is serving them. Mother Miriam folds up a linen    towel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flashback, Mother Miriam addresses Agnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sister Marguerite gives a snort of derision. Mother Miriam glances sharply at her, then turns back to Agnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two girls start to repeat it but Agnes starts to cry and Genevieve falters into silence. Mother Miriam goes on more kindly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still in flashback, Mother Miriam enters the room where SISTER PAUL lies dying. Father Martineau is there and many of the other nuns singing hymns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father Martineau annoints the old woman. Then Agnes quietly slips in   unobserved. Sister Paul rallies for a moment, tries to say a single silent word to her. The smile slips from Agnes' face. Then Sister Paul lies back and dies. 50   INT - CATHEDRAL - DAY Martha and the MONSIGNOR are walking through the church talking. He is quite young and has a rather abrasive manner. (beginning missed)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha stares at him as he walks away. 51   EXT - CONVENT - DAY A single shot of the back of the convent and the belltower. The bell is ringing. 52   INT - BELLTOWER - DAY Mother Miriam is ringing the bell and it takes quite a considerable effort. 53   EXT - CONVENT FARMYARD - DAY Agnes has a wheelbarrow full of straw and manure. She dumps it on a pile. 54   INT - COWSHED - DAY Martha is watching Agnes milking a cow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes carries the milk pail round to the churn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes falls to her knees. Martha moves round and kneels in front of her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (very upset) If you're trying to get me to say that she was a bad woman and hated me and didn't want me but that's not true, she was a good woman, a saint... (distorted)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes, I don't believe you know nothing about sex...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't help it if I'm stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... that you don't remember getting pregnant...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not my fault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... and that you don't believe you carried a child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the child?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything... I don't have children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't touch me like that! You don't touch me like that, I know what you want from me, you want to take God away. You should be ashamed, they should lock you up people like you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You hate us don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nuns... you hate nuns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate ignorance and stupidity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Catholic Church...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't said anything against the the Catholic Church.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Catholicism is not on trial here. I want you to deal with Agnes without any religious prejudice or you turn this case over to someone else...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How dare you tell me to run my affairs!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's my affair too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How dare you think I'm in a position to be pressured...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm only interested...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...    or bullied or what ever you're doing. Who    the hell do you think you are? You go    around here expecting applause for the    way you treated this child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She is not a child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And she has a right to know that there's a world out there filled with people who don't believe in God... (Mother Miriams walks on)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Innocence. Legal innocence. I know the judge would be happy for any reason to throw this case out of court.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, what do you need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When would Agnes have conceived the child?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, some time in January.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you remember anything unusual happening at the time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Earthquakes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Visitors to the convent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have a... a diary or a day book?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take at look at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was the child full term?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reads through the book) Oh, Dear God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The sheets...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What sheets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Dear God, I should have guessed... 48   INT - CONVENT DINING ROOM - NIGHT
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ... I should have suspected something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sister Marguerite says you have been sleeping on a bare mattress Sister. Is that true?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes Mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the medieval days the nuns and monks would sleep in their own coffins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're not in the Middle Ages, Sister.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It made them holy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It made them uncomfortable. And if they didn't sleep well I'm certain the next day they were cranky as mules. Sister where are your sheets? (no answer) Do you really believe that sleeping on a bare mattress is the equivalent of sleeping in a coffin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then tell me. Where are your sheets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I burnt them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a long pause) They were stained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many times have I burned into your thick skull and the thick skull of your fellow novice, that menstruation is a perfectly natural process and nothing to be ashamed of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and GENEVIEVE It is a perfectly natural process and nothing to be ashamed of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mean it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A few years ago one of the Sisters came to me in tears, asking for comfort, comfort because she was too old to have any children. Not that she wanted to, but once a month she had been reminded of that possibility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not that... it's not that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not my time of month.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Should you see a doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I don't know what happened Mother, I woke up... there was blood on the sheets, but I don't know what happened. (starts to weep) I don't know what I did wrong, I don't know and I should be punished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... I don't know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) That was the beginning, the night of the conception. That's why she burnt the sheets. 49   INT - SICKROOM - NIGHT
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) When was that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The twenty third of January. On that night one of our elder nuns passed away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Sister Paul?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yes. I don't remember where Agnes was. I was needed in the sick room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well you're probably right about that. It certainly can't help Sister Agnes to have this investigation continued for any length of time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you call it an investigation? I never have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your mother was a resident of Saint Catherines home before you moved her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does this have to do with..?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you had a sister who died in the convent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who told you this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you still go to church?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What business is it of yours..?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, we just wonder if you can be very objective about this case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Father, ah... just because I don't subscribe to the... to the beliefs you subscribe to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (halting) But what you believe makes no difference to us whatsoever Doctor. But it does make all the difference to Agnes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand. Are you expecting me to..?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well somone's got to suffer for this Doctor. You've got to be merciful and quick. Excuse me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes, I'm here because I want to help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you're troubled... aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's because you keep reminding me. If you go away then I'll forget.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you're unhappy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everyone's unhappy, you're unhappy aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me!    You never answer me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sometimes, yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only you think    you're lucky because you didn't have    a mother who said things to you and did    things to you that maybe weren't always    nice but that was because of me, because    I was bad, not her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm always bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I breathed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes. What did your mother do to you? (no answer) If you can't answer me, just shake your head yes or no. Did... did she hit you? (Anges shakes her head: no) Did she make you do something you didn't want to? (yes) Did it make you feel uncomfortable to do it? (yes) Did it embarrass you? (yes) Did it... did it hurt you? (yes) What did she make you you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You can tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead isn't she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't hurt you any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She watches... she listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes, I don't believe that. Tell me. I'll protect you from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... makes me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... take off my clothes and then... she makes fun of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tells you you're ugly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that you're stupid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That you're a mistake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She says my whole body's a mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because she says if I don't watch out I'll have a baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does she know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her headaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She touches me down there with a cigarette. (Martha gasps) Please Mommy, don't touch me like that any more. I'll be good, I won't be a baby any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes, oh Agnes, Agnes I want you to do something. I want you to pretend that I'm your mother. Oh yes, only this time I want you to tell me what you're feeling, alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please!    I want to help you. Let me help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes, you're ugly!... what do you say? Of course you do. Agnes, you're ugly!... what do you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I'm not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes is half shouting , half crying. Martha holds on to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha is in there by herself smoking. The elderly nun appears at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: responsible doesn't it?

direction.name: direction
