direction.raw_text: Right. (a pause) What do you suppose today's saints are smoking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are no saints today. Good people yes, but extraordinarily good people... those I'm afraid we are sorely lacking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think they ever existed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to become one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Become?     One is born a saint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you can try, can't you, to be good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but goodness has very little to do with it. Not all the saints were good, in fact some of them were a little crazy. But... they were still attached to God. Agnes has that birth. (she stands) No more... we're born, we live, we die. No room for miracles. (Martha gets up too) Oh my dear, how I miss the miracles. They start walking back to the convent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is painted white and completely empty with a steeply sloping    ceiling. Agnes is sitting on a chair with her eyes closed, already under   hypnosis. Martha and Mother Miriam are facing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha starts to walk around behind Agnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both Martha and Mother Miriam react with some degree of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you pretty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes, you're stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No I'm not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you intelligent?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (more forcefully) Yes I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) I'm not mistake, I'm here aren't I. How can I be a mistake if I'm really here. God doesn't make mistakes, you're a mistake...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Agnes, oh Agnes, it's alright, it's alright, it's alright, it's alright, I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you really love me or are you just saying that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As much as Mother Miriam does?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As much as God loves you. 55   INT - AGNES' OLD ROOM - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been watching. We were fine 'till she came. She brought the devil here. (makes the sign of the cross) There was blood on her hand that night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agnes? (the nun shakes her head) Who?     Mother Superior?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in French) ???
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look into the convent records.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sister...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slightly guiltily) Oh, Good afternoon Sister, I... I'm looking for some biographical data on Sister Agnes, and Mother said I might find it here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lied to me
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (brandishing the files) Your niece!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't tell you because I didn't think it was important.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it just makes you doubly
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never saw Agnes until she set foot in this convent. My sister ran away from home. We lost touch with her. And when my husband died and I came here, she wrote to me and asked me if I would take care of Agnes in case anything happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And Agnes' father?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could have been any one of a dozen men from what my sister told me. 57   INT - CORRIDOR - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) She was afraid that Agnes would follow in her footsteps. She did everything she could to prevent it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like keeping her home from school?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listening to angels?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She drank too much. That's what killed her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know what she did to her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think I care to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She molested her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, dear God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is more here than meets the eye isn't there? Lots of dirty little secrets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (crying) Oh God, if only I'd known.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you? You knew she was keeping her home from school. You knew she was an alcoholic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew that after the fact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you do anything to stop her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I didn't know... (she leaves)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Larry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marty, what are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Larry there's got to be something missing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I gave you the pictures Marty, what else do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something they... that they overlooked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? You think that the girl is innocent?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got to be crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Larry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with you, you've seen the reports. It's a cut and dried case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe there's something that's not in the report that should be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're too involved Marty. (lights her cigarette) Jesus look at you. Why don't you turn this case over to someone else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) I'll ask around, see what I come up with. In the meantime you go home and get some sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks. (she leaves)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling after her) If I find anything I'll call you. 59   INT - MARTHA'S APARTMENT - NIGHT
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hi Marty, it's Helen. Mrs Davenport called and was very upset that you'd missed her appointment. She wants you to call her at home, oh and a couple of reporters have been trying to get a hold of you about Sister Agnes. They seem persistent and they may try to reach you at home. I didn't give them number.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (French accent) Hallo, Doctor Livingston. My name is (?). I'm doing a Sunday article on Sister Agnes for the Gazette. I would appreciate it if you would give me a phone call on 942-2424.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hi Marty, it's me. Listen I just talked with Detective Crawley who was at the convent. She said that there was one thing that bothered her that didn't make it into the report. The waste paper basket. The one in Agnes' room. (Martha freezes in the middle of lighting up) None of the other nuns had one. Bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ... her that didn't make it into the report. The waste paper basket. The one in Agnes' room. None of the other nuns had one. Bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've gotten the court's permission to hypnotise her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And my permission?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like yours too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll see about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't deny it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't decided yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The woman's health is at stake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her spiritual health.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't give a damn about her spiritual health.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sentence her and be done with it, that's what you're saying and I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am saying (distorted) a beautifully simple woman...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An unhappy woman...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's happy with us and she could go on being happy if she was left alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why did you call the police in the first place Mother, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont.) Why didn't you just throw the baby into the incinerator and be done with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I am a moral person.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit yourself!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Catholic Church doesn't have a corner on morality...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who said anything about the Catholic Church...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just said...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell has the Catholic Church got to do with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What have we done to hurt you? And don't deny it, I can smell an ex-Catholic a mile away. What did we do? Burn a few heretics, sell some indulgences? That was in the days when the Church was a ruling body. We let governments do those things today. So what did we do to you eh? You wanted to neck in the back seat of a car when you were fifteen and you couldn't because it was a sin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) So instead of questioning that one rule...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (halting) It wasn't sex. It was a lot of things, but it wasn't sex. You know when I was in the first grade my best friend was run over on the way to school, you know what the nun said? She died because she hadn't said her morning prayers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stupid woman... and that's all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all? That's enough!   She was a beautiful little girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what has that to do with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't. I wasn't. She was the pretty one. She died, why not me? I never said my morning prayers. And I was ugly, I was scrawny, I had buck teeth and freckles all over my face, do you know what the nun called me, Sister Mary Clitus, called me Polkadot Livingston.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you left the Church because you had freckles?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, because I... yeah, yeah I left the Church cause I had freckles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When I was a child I used to hear my guardian angel. She sang to me 'till I was six years old. That's when I stopped listening. But I remember the voice. A few years ago I looked at myself and saw nothing but a nun who was certain of nothing. Not even of Heaven. Not even of God. And then one evening I saw Agnes standing by her window, singing. And all my doubts about myself and God were gone, in that one moment. I recognized the voice. Please don't take it away from me again Doctor Livingston. Those years after six were very bleak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My sister died in a convent. And it's her voice I hear. (a long pause) Does my smoking bother you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it reminds me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like one? Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd love one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm out of prac... (cough) ... practice. (cough)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine thanks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you suppose the saints would have smoked if tobacco had been popular back then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Undoubtedly. Not the ascetics of course but, well Saint Thomas More...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chuckles) Long, thin and filtered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Saint Ignatius would smoke cigars and stub them out on the soles of his bare feet. (they roar with laughter) And of course (distorted)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hand rolled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (imitating)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think Agnes is still attached to God?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to her singing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a pause) I'd like to begin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Begin what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The hypnotism. Do you still disapprove?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would it stop you if I did?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I be present?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then let's begin. 64   INT - ATTIC ROOM - DAY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're listening to a chorus of angels. The music surrounds you like a... warm and, comfortable pool of water. And while you're sleeping, you're going to be able to recall, all the things that we want you to remember. And when I count to three and clap my hands, you'll no longer be hypnotised. Can you hear me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doctor Livingston.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And why am I here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To help me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. Would you like to tell me why you're here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I'm in trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of trouble? (no answer) What kind of trouble Agnes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm frightened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of telling you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it's easy. It's just a breath with sound. Say it. What kind of trouble?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a pause) I had a baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you have a baby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It came out of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you know what was going to come out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Did you want it to come out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I was afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why were you afraid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I wasn't worthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be a mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I open my eyes now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No not yet Agnes, very soon but not yet. How did the baby get into you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It grew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What made it grow? Do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did anyone else know about the baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will she be angry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She made me promise not to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?     Who made you promise? (no answer) It's    alright Agnes. It's alright. (a pause) Let's    go to your room. It's the night about    six weeks ago when you were very    sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh don't be, I'm here. It's alright. I want you to tell me what you did before you went to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hm hmm. What did you have for dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fish... (distastefully) ... brussel sprouts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like brussel sprouts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate them. Martha and Mother Miriam can't help smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went to chapel for vespers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hm hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I left early because I wasn't feeling very well. Suddenly Agnes leaps up from her chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone's following me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sister Marguerite I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it Sister Marguerite who knew about the baby? (no answer) Alright Agnes, I want you to see your room as you saw it on that night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open your eyes. (she opens them) What do you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crucifix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Above the bed? Any... anything else? What do you you see, something different? What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wastepaper basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know who put it there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think it's there for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For me to get sick in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she falls to her knees, retching horribly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Agnes tries to crawl away as though terrified of something.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you feel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel as if I've eaten glass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to throw up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) I can't... glass... one of the sisters has fed me glass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know which one (distorted)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of me. Oh... God! My God... (assumes the birth position and looks between her legs) Water... it's all water...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why isn't anyone coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to wipe up the water) They can't hear me that's why. (in terrible pain) Oh God... I don't wanna...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Martha) Stop her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Please get away from me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go away, I don't want you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is someone in the room with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... don't hit me please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop this, she'll hurt herself (stepping forward) I'm not going to allow this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hauling her away) NO... no... I said leave her alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still screaming) You're trying to take my baby... trying to take my baby... no... (then quietly) It wasn't my fault Mommy... it was a mistake Mommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright Agnes... it's alright. One, two three... (claps her hands; Agnes comes to) It's alright... it's me, Doctor Livingston, it's alright, alright. Thankyou Agnes, thankyou. How do you feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember what just happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a long pause) Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good. Do you feel well enough to stand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Martha helps her to her feet. Agnes clings to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT - LAND REGISTRY - DAY Martha approaches the building and enters it. 66      INT - RECORD ROOM - DAY The camera tracks through shelves of ancient records and maps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha and a middle aged official come into view. He stops at a long set of        drawers and starts looking through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... very interesting I guess... (he pulls out a folder of plans) Excuse me... He sets the folder down on a table and starts going through it. They both look at the plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha starts drawing a rough plan. 67   INT - CRYPT - DAY The crypt is deserted but candles are burning in front of a statue of Saint Michael. Martha walks over to it,lights a candle and goes behind it and finds a stairway there leading underground. She goes down into... 68   INT - TUNNEL - DAY Martha walks through the dimly lit passage. She stops for a moment to look at a cross carved on the stone floor, then continues. Finally she reaches more steps and goes up into the... 69   INT - BARN - DAY Martha emerges through a trapdoor in to the barn which is full of doves. It    begins to make sense for her. 70   EXT - CITY - DAY Various closeups of famous statues. A bell is tolling. Two nuns come out of a building, down streets, across the road as though traffic did not exist and into another building. 71   INT - LIFT - DAY The nuns are Sister Anne and Mother Miriam. In the lift an OFFICE GIRL checks her lipstick in the reflective metal walls. The lift stops and the Sisters get off. 72   INT - CORRIDOR - DAY They walk down the modern carpeted corridor into... 73   INT - MARTHA'S OFFICE - DAY Mother Miriam addresses the secretary, HELEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She heads onto Martha's office. Helen jumps up after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam pushes the door open to reveal Martha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam walks in and throws some papers down onto Martha's desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There you go. It's alright, it's alright, it's all over. It's alright Agnes, that's right, that's right. 65
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off) Ah excuse me. Hallo. I'm looking for some ah... ground plans for the ah... Saint Marie Madeleine Convent in (distorted).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off) (answers in French)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in French)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (replies in French)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) Ah viola! This has everything. Even the secret entrance. They all had that. Usually to get from building to building in the snow... (he indicates on the plan) ... like that one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (murmurs) That's how he got in... or she got out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh excuse me, what did you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing. May I take some notes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yes, (distorted)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is the Doctor in her office?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, who shall I say is calling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) General MacArthur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a minute please, you can't go in there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (standing) It's... it's alright Helen, just close the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've just met with the bishop. We're taking you off the case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (picking up the papers) You're what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we want to hire a psychiatrist for Agnes. we'll find our own, thank you. (starts to leave)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One that will ask the questions you want asked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (halting) One that will approach this matter with some objectivity and respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the Church?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Agnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think she's a saint?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's been touched by God, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? How? She hallucinates, stops eating and bleeds spontaneously. Is that supposed to convince me she shouldn't be touched. Give me a miracle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why must he be anybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs and sits down) My God, you're as crazy as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop laughing, I don't say it's the truth, I'm saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How (distorted) ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well give me a reasonable explanation
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A miracle is an event without an explanation. If she's capable of putting a hole in her hand without benefit of a nail, why couldn't she split a cell in her womb?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There as no man in the convent on that night and no way for any man to get in or out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're saying God did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's as much as saying Father Martineau did it. I'm saying God permitted it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how did it happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll never find the answer for everything God did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you didn't believe in miracles today Mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I want the opportunity to believe. I want the choice to believe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what    you are choosing to believe is a lie    because you won't face the fact that she    was raped... or seduced... or that    she did the seducing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is an innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she is not an enigma Mother. Everything that Agnes has done is explainable from modern psychiatry. One, two, three, right down the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you believe she is?     The sum of her psychological parts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I have to believe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you so obsessed with her? You're losing sleep over her? (Martha gets up disturbed) You're thinking about her all the time. You're bent on saving her. Why? Martha has no answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes out and slams the door. 74   EXT - POND - DAY After a couple of establishing shots of the convent, the nuns are shown ice   skating on the frozen pond. They are quite uninhibited, like little children. Their singing (off) from the chapel continues until the end of scene 78. 75   INT - CHAPEL - DAY Sister Genevieve, the other novice is being consecrated. She approaches the altar all dressed in white, carrying a single candle and kneels down. 76   INT - LAW COURTS - DAY Martha and Justice Leveau come up the steps and into the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They reach the door of Leveau's office. He thinks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The scene consists of a number of shots dissolving into one another. Sister Genevieve lying face down in front of the bishop, Genevieve praying on her   knees, her family (4) watching from behind the grilled gate. Genevieve's hair being cut, her joy at the habit being fitted to her, running out to join her family, a jolly old singalong on the piano, this time the nuns singing along from    behind the gate. 78   EXT - CONVENT - DAY Martha drives up in her car and walks across the now snow covered grounds to    the convent. 79   INT - MOTHER MIRIAM'S OFFICE - DAY Mother Miriam is working away at her desk when a nun interrupts. Singing   from the party can faintly be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam nods tiredly and goes to meet Martha at he door. Martha hands    her a court order. Mother Miriam reads it briefly and hands it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a few more questions to ask her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, but you're determined. They move back into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knew she was pregnant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you insist upon pressing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it because she's a nun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know she was pregnant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you didn't send her to a doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't guess until it was too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?     An abortion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't be ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late for what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... too late to stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The scandal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You went to the room to help with the birth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't want any help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is the same as before, except that this time Martha and Mother Miriam are      standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a flash cut to Sister Paul being annointed. Agnes stirs slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is another flash cut, this time of Sister Paul saying that mysterious word that we could not previously understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a third flash cut of the shrine of Saint Michael in the crypt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flashback:    Agnes is walking alone through the tunnel carrying an oil lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes keeps walking and finally goes up the steps into... 82   INT - BARN - NIGHT Still in flashback, Agnes emerges into the barn. The doves flap about as Agnes    moves nervously through the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back to the present:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. 84   INT - BARN - NIGHT In flashback: the doves continue to make flapping and bumping sounds as they fly around the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the present:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flashback:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she seems to be talking to someone although we can see nothing except the doves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the present:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flashback: Agnes is still in the barn but now she is lying on her back. Still all we can see are doves flashing in the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she lifts up her hands. 89   INT - ATTIC ROOM - DAY In the present: as she lifts up her hands, Agnes is horrified to see two holes in her palms weeping blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha and Mother Miriam are equally shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes runs terrified over to the walls blood pouring over her white habit.    Mother Miriam rushes after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes breaks free and runs over to another wall smearing it too with blood.     Martha follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agnes flings her arms back against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somehow this declaration seems to calm them down somewhat. Mother Miriam   is looking utterly resigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Miriam gives a shuddering sigh, makes the sign of the cross and prays. Martha claps her hands lightly together once. 90   EXT - CITY - DAY A shaft of sunlight shines through the winter clouds onto the city. Angle on the courthouse. 91   INT - COURT ROOM - DAY All the main characters are present: Eve, Lyon, Martha, Agnes, Sister   Marguerite and Mother Miriam. Justice Leveau is summing up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both Martha and Mother Miriam show relief at this. Justice Leveau continues to sum up in French when suddenly Agnes stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha and Mother Miriam step forward uncertainly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont.) (calmer) I'm not accusing. I'm recognizing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a tunnel out of the crypt into the barn. Did you know about that? There's an answer Mother. That's how she got out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's crazy. How could she find out about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody told her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who? That tun... that tunnel hasn't been used in fifty years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, would you stop lying Mother!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would I lie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because it's murder we're talking about. Aren't you concerned about what she told us about the other person in her room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm concerned about her health.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who was that person Mother?    Was it you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you believe this is murder, it is the Crown attorney you have to talk to, not me. And definitely not Agnes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All I want is one more week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? (continues in French, then...) You've done nothing to show any progress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, that's because I'm getting to her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're getting to all of us Martha, let's face it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have a decision by next week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's gone on long enough. You're out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Joe... Joe she didn't kill the baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (halting) You have proof?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have it.
dialogue.name: dialogue
